Package view

Class View

java.lang.Object
view.View
Direct Known Subclasses:
AdminAddStaffView, AdminAllStaffView, AdminAppointmentView, AdminInventoryView, AdminManageDatabaseView, AdminManageStaffView, AdminReplenishmentRequestView, AdminUpdateInventoryView, AdminUpdateStaffDetailsView, AdminUpdateStaffView, AdminView, DoctorAppointmentRequestsView, DoctorAvailabilityView, DoctorManageAppointmentsView, DoctorPatientMedicalRecordView, DoctorPatientsUnderCareView, DoctorRecordAppointmentOutcomeView, DoctorScheduleView, DoctorUpdateMedicalRecordDetailsView, DoctorUpdateOutcomeDetailsView, DoctorView, DoctorViewAppointmentDetailsView, DoctorViewPastAppointmentsView, LoginUpdatePasswordView, LoginView, PatientAppointmentView, PatientCancelAppointmentView, PatientMedicalRecordDetailsView, PatientMedicalRecordView, PatientPastAppointmentsView, PatientPendingAppointmentsView, PatientRescheduleAppointmentView, PatientScheduleAppointmentView, PatientUpdateDetailsView, PatientView, PharmacistInventoryView, PharmacistPrescribeMedicineView, PharmacistPrescriptionView, PharmacistReplenishmentRequestView, PharmacistView
public abstract class View extends Object
This abstract class represents a view of the application. Each actual view must implement all the methods of this class.
Since:
2024-11-10

  • Field Details

    • context

      public BuildContext context
      The default BuildContext implemented by a view. Can be overriden to use a new build context.

    • getViewName

      public abstract String getViewName()
      Gets the name of the View to be used in generating the breadcrumbs using Navigator.getBreadcrumbs().
      Returns:
      the name of the view.
      See Also:
      • Navigator

    • render

      public abstract void render()
      Describes the user interface of this View. This method should contain only view logic. Here's an example of the render method of a view that is 100 characters wide by 10 lines tall. 
       public void render() {
     // The BuildContext specifies the context surrounding the widget,
     // in our case is just the dimensions of the canvas.
     BuildContext context = new BuildContext(100, 10);
     
     // The main view widgets to draw. Widgets can be composed and painted 
     // together using multichild widgets.
     new Column(
         new Text("Welcome to HMS app!"),
         new VSpacer(1),
         new Text("Login Now")
     ).paint(context);
     
     // Multiple Widgets can also be used and painted separately.
     new Text("Bye").paint(context);
 
     // Traditional methods also work.
     System.out.println("Say no to widgets");
 
     // Text inputs should be at the last after all view widgets.
     TextInputField password = new TextInputField("Password");
     new TextInput(password).read(context, (password) -> password.equals("123"));
 
     // This line is called after the read completes and the input is valid.
     Navigator.navigateTo(new HomeScreen());
 }
      See Also:
      • BuildContext
      • Column
      • Text
      • VSpacer
      • TextInput
      • Navigator
      • Widget

    • paint

      public void paint()
      Clears the screen and paints the view by calling render().

    • repaint

      public void repaint()
      Clears the screen and paints the view again. This method is used solely for contextual purposes and is identical to paint.

    • clear

      public static void clear()
      Utility method to clear the screen.

      public static void gotoPrevNthLine(int n)
      Utility method to move the cursor up by n lines.
      Parameters:
      n - the number of lines to move up by.

    • clearLine

      public static void clearLine()
      Utility method to move up the cursor by one line, and clear that line.

    • clearLines

      public static void clearLines(int count)
      Utility method to clear the last count lines.
      Parameters:
      count - the number of previous lines to clear.
